alert.note: Alert for Northern Oneida; Southern Oneida (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 09 at 1:08PM EST until January 09 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... ...LAKE EFFECT SNOW WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 1 AM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Patchy drizzle and freezing drizzle will persist through this afternoon. Icy patches may develop even in places where the air temperature is above freezing, as ground temperatures remain very cold. Additional accumulation will be a light glaze. Lake effect snow will develop later this evening, lasting through Monday night. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 20 inches in northern Oneida County, highest in the northwest, and 6 to 12 inches in Southern Oneida County, with lower amounts in southeastern areas. * WHERE...Northern Oneida and Southern Oneida counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 4 PM EST this afternoon. For the Lake Effect Snow Warning, from 4 PM this afternoon to 1 AM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult to impossible tonight and Monday. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning and evening commutes Monday.
info.instruction: The latest road conditions for New York can be found at 511ny.org or by dialing 5 1 1 from within the state. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
